intro: Zuccagnia angulata, commonly known as the angular leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its angular, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Zuccagnia angulata is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its distinctive foliage and showy blooms.
